meanings.definition: In a delicate or intricate manner.
meanings.sent1: She sewed the buttons on the dress lacily, taking her time to ensure they were perfectly placed.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina danced lacily across the stage, captivating the audience with her graceful movements.
meanings.sent3: The spider spun its web lacily, creating a beautiful and intricate design in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved lacily over the piano keys, producing a melody that filled the room with magic.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the delicate flowers lacily onto the canvas, each petal a work of art in itself.

meanings.sent1: The swan glided lacily across the pond, its movements so graceful and serene.
meanings.sent2: She greeted the guests at the party lacily, with a smile that lit up the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched out lazily, then jumped lacily onto the windowsill, looking out at the world.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fell from the tree lacily, swirling and dancing in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The model walked lacily down the runway, exuding confidence and elegance with every step.
